III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff and nurse are verbally abusing Youth A.
Investigation On 4/8/24, I emailed Foster Care Worker (FCW 1). No other
information was provided.
On 4/8/24, I left a voicemail for Complainant 1. I have not
received a returned phone call.
Administrator 1
On 4/8/24, I spoke to Administrator 1 and allegations were
discussed. Administrator 1 reported Youth A is consistently
breaking glass and placing others, including himself in unsafe
situations. Administrator 1 reported she has not been aware of
anyone being physically or verbally assaultive towards Youth A,
only that staff have provided safety for him.
Youth A
On 4/10/24 Youth A was interviewed by Consultant 1 and I. Youth
A was no longer at Holy Cross Queen of Angels. Consultant 1 was
at the Midland County Juvenile Center, and I was on the phone.
Youth A reported his interactions with the nurse on site were
always appropriate. Youth A reported she never hurt him
physically or spoke abusively to him. Youth A reported he only
interacted with her when he received medical care. When asked
about how staff communicated with him, Youth A reported staff
have never said anything to him that was inappropriate or abusive.
2

Nurse 1
I interviewed Nurse 1 face to face at the facility on 4/10/24. Nurse
1 reported she has never stated anything inappropriate or
disrespectful to Youth A. Nurse 1 reported she would help
deescalate Youth A verbally and redirect him on different
occasions due to the unsafe behavior Youth A exhibited.
Staff 1 and Staff 2
Both Staff 1 and Staff 2 reported they never spoke to Youth A
inappropriate, disrespectful or in an abusive manner. Both
reported they had interactions with Youth A to deescalate his
unsafe behaviors. Both reported they never heard anyone else
speak in an abusive manner to him either.
Documents Reviewed:
• I reviewed their behavior management policy which
prohibits verbal abuse as a form of intervention.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Youth A reported no one
has verbally disrespected him or used abusive words towards him.
Nurse 1, Administrator 1, Staff 1, and Staff 2 also confirmed this in
interviews.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged staff have punched Youth A in the stomach, twisted
his arm and grabbed him.
Investigation On 4/8/24, I emailed Foster Care Worker (FCW 1). No other
information was provided.
On 4/8/24, I left a voicemail for Complainant 1. I have not
received a returned phone call.
3

Youth A
On 4/10/24 Youth A was interviewed by Consultant 1 and I. Youth
A was no longer at Holy Cross Queen of Angels. Consultant 1 was
at the Midland County Juvenile Center, and I was on the phone.
Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 physically assaulted him.
Youth A reported they would “punch, push, and grab” him. Youth
A was unable to provide details on when this occurred. Youth A
reported it happened in the hallways. Youth A reported Staff 2
bent his fingers back once. Youth A reported he had “something”
in his hand but couldn’t recall what it was. Youth A reported this
was why Staff 2 bent his fingers back. Youth A was unable to
provide any details on any of the allegations. Youth A reported
Nurse 1 never physically hit him.
Nurse 1
I interviewed Nurse 1 face to face at the facility on 4/10/24. Nurse
1 reported she has never physically assaulted Youth A. Nurse 1
reported she has been attacked by Youth A with a piece of glass
and witnessed staff place him in a standing hold to stop his violent
behavior. Nurse 1 reported the staff (unknown) in that situation
completed the standing hold appropriately. Nurse 1 reported she
has never been involved in an incident with Staff 1 or Staff 2.
Nurse 1 reported she has seen Youth A attack staff and staff allow
him to punch them, while they are attempting to verbally
deescalate Youth A. Nurse 1 reported she has also seen Youth A
pick up glass and staff remove that glass from his hands. Nurse 1
reported this happened a few times. Nurse 1 reported the times
that she had seen this, the staff (unknown) did it appropriately.
Staff 1
I interviewed Staff 1 face to face at the facility on 4/10/24. Staff 1
reported he was involved with a situation with Youth A when
Youth A attempted to break into the company van in the parking
lot. Staff 1 reported he kept standing in between the van and
Youth A. Staff 1 reported he never had to restrain Youth A and did
not physically assault him. Staff 1 reported during another time,
Youth A was attempting to grab the fire extinguisher from the wall
and Staff 1 pulled his arms back from grabbing it. Staff 1 reported
there was another incident when Youth A was attempting to break
the window in an office and Staff 1 redirected him. Youth A did not
listen and pushed the glass, and it broke. Staff 1 reported he
grabbed Youth A’s hands at that time, because the glass pieces
were in Youth A’s hands and Youth A was attempting to close his
hands around the glass. Staff 1 reported they took him to the
hospital on that occasion. Staff 1 reported all staff were “well-
versed” in how to interact with Youth A. Staff 1 reported he never
4

physically assaulted Youth A and never seen any staff become
aggressive with Youth A or assault Youth A.
Staff 2
I interviewed Staff 2 on 5/13/24 via telephone. Staff 2 reported she
was involved in one incident where she had to restrain Youth A.
Staff 2 reported Youth A had completed a court hearing and was
getting ready to go to school when he took off running and went
outside. Youth A found a pipe near the maintenance shed and
went around the building and broke five windows and two doorway
windows. Staff 2 reported he climbed through the doorway window
and locked the door. Staff 2 was able to get through the door and
Youth A had a large piece of glass in his hand. Staff 2 reported
she had restrained him and held him down until police came, this
restraint was appropriately conducted. Staff 2 reported she has
never seen any staff physically assault Youth A and staff keep him
safe. Staff 2 reported she has never physically assaulted Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
I requested and reviewed any incident reports that had Nurse 1,
Staff 1 or Staff 2 involved with deescalating Youth A.
• Incident report dated 3/20/24 included Staff 2. Staff’ 2s
interview is consistent with the incident report.
• Incident report dated 2/21/24 included Staff 1. Staff 1’s
interview is consistent with the incident report.
• Incident report dated 3/22/24 included Nurse 1. Nurse 1’s
interview is consistent with the incident report. Staff 1 and
Staff 2 were not involved in this incident.
• I reviewed their behavior management policy which
prohibits physical punishment as a form of intervention.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Youth A was unable to
provide details to being physically assaulted by staff other than
reporting Staff 1 grabbed him and bent his fingers back and Staff
2 punched and pushed him. These incidents, if in fact the
incidents reported on documentation above, reveal Youth A
creating a dangerous situation for himself and others around him.
Staff acted appropriately in each situation.
• Due to the unsafe behaviors of Youth A, Staff 1 did have to
hold his hands to stop him from hurting himself.
5

• Staff 2 did have to restrain Youth A which would result in
Staff 2 “grabbing” him. Based on interviews and incident
reports, the allegations are unfounded.
• Nurse 1 witnessed staff conducting a standing hold
appropriately. She also witnessed staff removing glass from
Youth A’s hand and staff allowing Youth A to punch them
without staff retaliating.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
